q: Is Swiss German University accredited by BAN-PT?
a: Yes, SGU is fully accredited by BAN-PT, with several programs holding 'A' and 'B' accreditation.

q: Is SGU’s degree recognized internationally?
a: Yes. Through the double degree program, graduates receive one degree from SGU and one from a European partner university.

q: How is SGU’s reputation compared to other private universities in Indonesia?
a: SGU is known for its international curriculum, English-taught programs, and strong partnerships with European universities and industries.

q: Which partner universities abroad are available for the double degree program?
a: SGU partners with universities in Germany, Switzerland, and Austria, depending on the study program.

q: Are there any SGU alumni who have succeeded internationally?
a: Yes, many SGU alumni work in global companies or pursue postgraduate studies abroad.

q: What study programs are offered at SGU?
a: Undergraduate programs include Engineering, Information Technology, Business & Management, Life Sciences, and Social Sciences.

q: Can students change majors after the first semester?
a: Yes, with academic approval and availability in the desired program.

q: What makes SGU’s learning system different from other universities?
a: SGU emphasizes practical learning, bilingual education, and international exposure through its double degree and internship programs.

q: Are all courses taught in English?
a: Yes, all courses are delivered in English by both local and international lecturers.

q: What if my English proficiency is not strong enough?
a: SGU provides an English Preparatory Program (EPP) to help students improve their language skills before starting regular classes.

q: What teaching methods are applied at SGU?
a: A mix of lectures, lab work, projects, presentations, and case studies is used to enhance learning outcomes.

q: Are there programs to develop soft skills like leadership and teamwork?
a: Yes, SGU integrates soft skill training into the curriculum and extracurricular activities.

q: How does the double degree system work at SGU?
a: Students spend three years studying in Indonesia and one year at a European partner university.

q: Are all students eligible for the double degree program?
a: Yes, all SGU students are required to complete the double degree as part of the curriculum.

q: How much is the tuition fee per semester at SGU?
a: Tuition ranges from IDR 25–35 million per semester, depending on the program.

q: Does SGU offer scholarships for new students?
a: Yes, SGU offers scholarships based on academic merit, achievements, and talents.

q: What laboratory and library facilities are available?
a: SGU has modern labs for each major and provides access to international e-journals through its digital library.

q: Does SGU provide internship opportunities for students?
a: Yes, internships are mandatory—one in Indonesia and one abroad during the double degree program.

q: Which companies are SGU’s industry partners?
a: Partners include Siemens, BMW, Bosch, Unilever, and many other international and local companies.

q: What is student life like at SGU?
a: Students can join various clubs, student organizations, and sports teams, fostering a vibrant campus community.

q: Does SGU have dormitory or housing facilities?
a: SGU assists students in finding nearby accommodation and provides dormitory recommendations.

q: How does SGU support students’ career preparation?
a: The Career Center helps students with job placements, internships, and networking opportunities with industry partners.

q: What are the admission requirements for undergraduate programs?
a: Applicants need a high school diploma, English proficiency proof (TOEFL/IELTS or SGU test), and supporting documents.

q: Is there an entrance exam or interview for admission?
a: Yes, SGU conducts entrance assessments to evaluate applicants’ academic and language readiness.

q: What makes SGU graduates stand out from others?
a: SGU graduates are bilingual, internationally exposed, and experienced through two internships, making them highly competitive in the global market.
